Ingredients.1: 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.13: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Bring a large pot of lightly-salted water to a rolling boil. Add beans and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes. (The beans will not soften too much more during baking, so if you want them softer, cook to your preference.)

Directions.2: Drain beans, run under cold water, and place in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. When beans are chilled, drain and set aside.

Directions.3: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray the inside of 4 ramekins with cooking spray.

Directions.4: Melt butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and shallot and cook until they start to brown, 2 to 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

Directions.5: Sprinkle flour over the mushrooms, stirring well to combine. Gradually pour in chicken stock, soy sauce, Dijon, and thyme, stirring constantly; the mixture will be thick at this point. Stir in half-and-half, salt, and pepper until well combined. Reduce heat to low and simmer until flavors have melded and sauce has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes.

Directions.6: Stir in green beans and bacon until well combined. Spoon into the prepared ramekins and top with French-fried onions.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven for 13 to 15 minutes. Serve immediately.
